metadata.title: CVE-2022-31748 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Mozilla developers Gabriele Svelto, Timothy Nikkel, Randell Jesup, JonCoppeard, and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs presentin Firefox 100. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption andwe presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploitedto run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 101.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
